content: Singaporean satay dishThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Satay bee hoon" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2016)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Satay bee hoon** is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporean_cuisine) dish. It was created due to cultural fusion of the [Malays](/wiki/Malays_(ethnic_group)) or [Javanese](/wiki/Javanese_people) with the [Teochew people](/wiki/Teochew_people) who immigrated to Singapore. Satay bee hoon sauce is a [chilli](/wiki/Chili_pepper)-based [peanut](/wiki/Peanut) sauce very similar to the one served with [satay](/wiki/Satay). The [satay sauce](/wiki/Peanut_sauce) is spread on top of rice [vermicelli](/wiki/Vermicelli). ## Ingredient The main ingredient of satay bee hoon is satay sauce. [Cuttlefish](/wiki/Cuttlefish), [kang kong](/wiki/Kang_kong), [bean sprouts](/wiki/Bean_sprouts), [pork](/wiki/Pork) slices, [prawns](/wiki/Shrimp_and_prawn_as_food) and [cockles](/wiki/Cockle_(bivalve)) can be added to the vermicelli before spreading the sauce. - [Ketoprak](/wiki/Ketoprak_(dish)), a similar dish from Jakarta, Indonesia, that contains rice vermicelli, rice cake, tofu and beansprouts in peanut sauce. - [Cuisine of Singapore](/wiki/Cuisine_of_Singapore) - [Peanut sauce](/wiki/Peanut_sauce) - [List of peanut dishes](/wiki/List_of_peanut_dishes) - [Rice noodles](/wiki/Rice_noodles) - Asian food recipe - satay beehoon recipe This article related to [Chinese cuisine](/wiki/Chinese_cuisine) is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Satay bee hoon
